medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first patient presented with abdominal pain at the age of 62. The second patient, a twin, developed abdominal pain, jaundice, and weight loss at age 63. The first patient experienced complete remission during 2 years of rituximab therapy after failing to respond to prednisolone.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient one had undergone surgical fusion of the second lumbar vertebra to the sacrum for degenerative scoliosis. The second patient underwent removal of a mass in the hepatic hilum, indicative of IgG4-related disease.
